intro: Heinsenia, commonly known as the common heath. It is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae, characterized by its evergreen shrubs with small, leathery leaves. The flowers are typically bell-shaped and come in shades of white, pink, or red, often arranged in clusters. Heinsenia species are adapted to acidic, well-drained soils and are often found in heathland or coastal areas. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
